SENT.plain: Distal myopathy with rimmed vacuoles (DMRV) is a major entity of distal myopathy
It is an autosomal recessive disorder and is due to mutations in the GNE gene that regulates the synthesis of sialic acid
Although reported predominantly from Japan, cases have been reported from other parts of the world
We report the first genetically proven case of DMRV from India in a 23-year-old male with gradual onset, progressive distal weakness of both lower limbs with features of inflammation in muscle biopsy
